bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 94 (Wednesday, June 5, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. PAPPAS:H.R. 3140.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, clause 3 and Article I, Section 8,clause 18 of the United States Constitution.[Page H4344]

item.name: Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

item.name: Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

summary.text:
Commercial Fishing Industry Vessel Clarification Act

This bill modifies provisions concerning uninspected fishing vessels to prescribe and require the prescription of certain safety standards on fishing, fish tender, or fish processing vessels.

Among other things, the bill addresses

  • vessel construction standards,
  • regulations for the operating stability of vessels,
  • training requirements for vessel operators,
  • vessel certification requirements,
  • the alternate safety compliance program,
  • the substitute safety compliance program,
  • the enhanced substitute safety compliance program,
  • record keeping requirements for vessel operators,
  • vessel inspection requirements,
  • the Fishing Safety Training Grant Program, and
  • the Fishing Safety Research Grant Program.

bill.title: Commercial Fishing Industry Vessel Clarification Act

item.title: Commercial Fishing Industry Vessel Clarification Act
To amend title 46, United States Code, to set standards for the operation of uninspected commercial fishing vessels, and for other purposes.
Commercial Fishing Industry Vessel Clarification Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
